title: Apollo Co-Founder Josh Harris to Leave Day-to-Day Role
sub_head: Harris to remain a member of the board and its executive committee
body:
Josh Harris, co-founder of Apollo Global Management Inc., will step down from day-to-day responsibilities at the firm early next year to focus on his personal investments, the firm said.
Mr. Harris, who for years oversaw daily operations at Apollo, was sidelined in January when the firm said Chief Executive Leon Black would cede his role to co-founder Marc Rowan later in the year after revelations of Mr. Black’s ties to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.
Apollo had said in July 2020 that Mr. Rowan would take a step back from his regular responsibilities and embark on a “semisabbatical.” To some people close to the firm, that seemed to pave the way for Mr. Harris to take the top executive spot.
Mr. Black in March stepped down as chairman, citing health issues, and formally handed the CEO role to Mr. Rowan.
Apollo said Mr. Harris would remain a board member and a member of the firm’s executive committee but would end his day-to-day involvement with the investment giant after the closing of its deal to acquire insurance affiliate Athene Holding Ltd. , expected in the first quarter of 2022.
